text:
The jallikattu allegedly organised in a village in Kanakapura taluk in Karnataka, bordering Tamil Nadu on Sunday.— Photo: Special Arrangement

Defying the Supreme Court ban on jallikattu, the sport was allegedly organised in a village in Kanakapura taluk bordering Tamil Nadu on Sunday.

The incident came to light after some villagers shared photographs and video of the event with Kannada media channels on Monday.

The sport was reportedly organised in Kalagondanahalli village, 15 km away from the border of Tamil Nadu, on the occasion of the inauguration of a Rama mandir. .

Chandragupta, SP, Ramanagaram, told The Hindu that he had ordered a probe into the incident by the Deputy Superintendent of Police and asked him to submit a report in two days.

“Local police were neither intimated nor permission taken for the temple event,” Mr. Chandragupta said.

Police have collected the photographs and videos and verifying them. The Hindu could not independently verify the authenticity of the photographs.
title: Police probing report on jallikattu in village on Karnataka-TN border
